settings.title: People with chronic illnesses feel invisible.
settings.subtitle: Buoyâ€™s first campaign starts with a short film spotlighting those fighting silent battles.
settings.text: From friends and family to healthcare professionals and even social media algorithms, chronic illnesses chronically go unseen and unheard.
settings.link_text: Press Play Above â€” Then Share

settings.title: We need your help.
settings.text:
Help us push the conversation around chronic illness culture to the front of our culture.

Stitch this video on TikTok with #ToBeSeen and share your story relating to an illness. If you don't have an illness, you can speak about the movement.

It's time for this community To Be Seen.

settings.title: Sugar
settings.subtitle: Found in: Gatorade, Liquid IV, Nuun
settings.text: Not only does sugar cause inflammation and disease, it can also make you more dehydrated. Sugar intake can work against electrolyte function.

settings.title: Stevia
settings.subtitle: Found In: Ultima, LMNT, Nuun
settings.text: Stevia was prohibited in consumer products until 1991 in the United States and 2018 in the European Union for its connections to gut inflammation, kidney disease and cancer. Sugar lobbyists paid to regulate it.

settings.title: Dextrose
settings.subtitle: Found In: Gatorade, Liquid IV, Nuun
settings.text: A simple sugar derived from corn, dextrose consumption causes fluid build up, spikes in blood pressure and excessive thirst.

settings.title: Natural Flavors
settings.subtitle: Found In: Liquid IV, Nuun
settings.text: The FDA allows any food additive originating in nature to be labeled as a Natural Flavor, meaning sketchy solvents and preservatives like BHA and  propylene glycol are basically perfumes for your mouth. Vanilla and Strawberry originate from compounds in beaver anal and sexual glands.

settings.title: Bad Form Factors
settings.text: Liquid electrolytes are more bioavailable and faster absorbing than powders and tablets. Often times, electrolytes in powders and tablets get left behind in your cup and glass.

settings.title: Artificial Ingredients
settings.text: Thereâ€™s a laundry list of ingredients from dyes, oils, chemical alternatives to electrolytes, blending and bleaching agents and artificial ingredients added in for taste that you can find in natural grocery markets.

settings.title: Why Buoy?
settings.text:
Hydration supplements are one of the first things healthcare professionals recommend for managing chronic conditions.

Unfortunately, powders, tablets and sports drinks use dodgy ingredients that exacerbate health issues.

settings.testimonial: "Doesn't hurt my stomach like the others"
settings.author: Paula Sojo, Crohn's & POTS

settings.title: Get Your Chronic Illness Discount
settings.text: Get an additional 15% off Buoy's already discounted subscription plan if you have a chronic illnesses and you're looking for clean hydration.

settings.title: Donations to Nonprofits
settings.text: We donate for every bottle sold on our website to a verified 501(c)3 nonprofit supporting chronic illness communities. If you donâ€™t have an illness, you can still support those who do.

settings.title: Chronic Illness Creators
settings.text: For Summer 22, weâ€™re investing only in creators with chronic conditions. These talented creators are often tokenized, unpaid and under-represented and itâ€™s time they got their bag.

settings.title: Thanks for your support.
settings.text:
Creating this campaign is the single most rewarding aspect of founding Buoy. I worked with four creators pushing our culture forward. I watched Stew Caldo and Apphia Castillo redefine brand storytelling with their creative firm Round Two Agency. And I finally celebrated Buoy and our founding teamâ€™s core value of giving back thatâ€™s been a north start for us since day one.

Sharing this campaign with friends, family and coworkers means the world to us and this community. Every voice counts.
